purpose: Custom radio group UI components built on top of Radix UI's radio group primitives, providing styled and accessible radio button functionality for React applications

variables.name: RadioGroup
variables.purpose: Container component for grouping radio button items
variables.usage: Wraps RadioGroupItem components and manages radio button selection state

variables.name: RadioGroupItem
variables.purpose: Individual radio button component with custom styling
variables.usage: Represents a single selectable option within a RadioGroup

key_points: Wraps Radix UI RadioGroup primitives with custom styling
Uses React.forwardRef for proper ref forwarding
Implements two components: RadioGroup (container) and RadioGroupItem (individual radio buttons)
Leverages Tailwind CSS classes for styling through the cn utility
Provides accessibility features inherited from Radix UI

patterns: Component composition pattern using Radix UI primitives
forwardRef pattern for ref forwarding to underlying DOM elements
Spread props pattern for API flexibility
CSS-in-JS utility function (cn) for conditional class merging
Display name assignment for better debugging experience
issues: Hard-coded styling values (h-4 w-4, h-2.5 w-2.5) might limit customization flexibility
No TypeScript interfaces or props documentation for component consumers
Could benefit from size variants (small, medium, large) for different use cases
Missing ARIA labels or descriptions that might enhance accessibility beyond Radix defaults
